page.title: 14Grove Farm,Great Kimble
page.content: We were shown around the farm by MR.M.R Willis the farm manger for MR.J.W Robarts who owns the farm.The date was 2\7\85.There are 683 acres under cultivation .The crops are Winter Barley and Winter Wheat.The soil is too wet and too heavy in the spring for the seeds to germinate.Winter Wheat varieties are Avalone,Mission(for milling )and Norman ,Gallahad (for feeding). Winter barley variety is Igri (for feed). Permanent grass is for feeding the Store Cattle and a suckling herd of 54 animals.The breed of suckling herd is Simmental. There are cows,2 bulls and male & female calves. The store cattle are Charolais which are bought in at 500 kg, fattened until they weigh 850kg and are then sold. Because of the heavy land the animals are kept in sheds during winter and fed with Hay and Silage.
